link_name: Paradip refinery to turn around IOC's prospects

status_message: Facebook alleged that someone at telecom regulator Trai's office blocked email from its websites, which people used for sharing their comments on differential pricing issue. "Someone with access to designated Trai email account appears to have blocked receipt of all emails from Facebook to that Trai account."
link_name: Facebook accuses Trai of blocking Free Basics campaign emails

status_message: The Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) expects the share of internet ticketing through its portal to touch 80 per cent in the next three years, up from 56-58 per cent now. In 2014-15, the share of internet ticketing passengers to total passengers was 54.5 per cent.
link_name: IRCTC expects its share of rail tickets to touch 80%

status_message: In the past 10 years, the sex ratio has significantly decreased in nine out of 11 states of India, whereas women's literacy has gone up in each of those states, according to the first phase of the latest national family health survey, known as NFHS-4.
link_name: Sex ratio down, literacy rate of women up: Family health survey

status_message: Defending the exit of Khan from the Incredible India campaign, Secretary, department of industrial policy and promotion (DIPP), Amitabh Kant said the actor, by terming India an 'intolerant country', worked against his role as that of a brand ambassador.
link_name: Aamir damaged India's brand identity, says DIPP secretary

status_message: HCL Technologies today reported a net profit jump of 11.2% of Rs 1,920 crore for the quarter that ended in December 2015. Its rupee revenue stood at Rs 10,341 crore, up 2.4%
link_name: HCL Technologies' net profit jumps 11% to Rs 1,920 cr

status_message: Ahead of the Union Budget for 2016-17, a committee asked to make recommendations on simplifying the current income tax (I-T) law has recommended a higher threshold for deduction of tax at source and cuts in rates, plus measures to reduce litigation.
link_name: Easwar panel wants higher threshold & lower rates for TDS on bank deposits

status_message: French President Francois Hollande on Monday pledged to redefine France's business model and declared what he called "a state of economic and social emergency," unveiling a euro 2-billion ($2.2 billion) plan to revive hiring and catch up with a fast-moving world economy.
link_name: Hollande declares economic emergency

status_message: Mumbaikars will continue to enjoy 24x7, 365 days of uninterrupted power supply for at least a decade despite demand going up with a CAGR of 3-4%. This is due to installation of additional transmission lines by two private power players, Tata Power and Reliance Infrastructure.
link_name: No power cut for Mumbai at least for a decade

status_message: Aditya Birla Group will have three top management changes by end of March with something unique that billionaire Kumar Mangalam Birla insists for leadership roles now. This is what he defined as two-by-two-by-two for group succession strategy in leadership summit concluded last month at a sub-urban city hotel.
link_name: Aditya Birla Group to have 3 top mgmt changes

status_message: Just 62 individuals had the same wealth as 3.5 billion peopleâ€”the bottom half of humanityâ€”in 2015, according to a new report, An Economy For The 1%, by Oxfam, a global advocacy.
link_name: All of 62 people have same wealth as 3.5 billion

status_message: State-run Bharat Sanchar Nigam Ltd (BSNL) on Friday said it has extended the scheme giving 80 per cent reduction in mobile rates to its existing customers, with effect from Saturday.
link_name: BSNL cuts mobile rates by up to 80% for old customers

status_message: Prime Minister Modi has moved for peace with Pakistan with a lot of conviction and deserves our unstinted support writes Aditi Phadnis
link_name: Aditi Phadnis: Why Modi deserves a big hand
Top level rejig at Max Group after Max India Ltd demerger

status_message:
A sub-committee of a panel set up by the department of pharmaceuticals (DoP) wants restrictions on online pharmacies.
It has asked for a ban on these being used as outlets for high-risk drugs and mandatory licensing of the physical premises where such orders are processed.
link_name: Govt panel pushes for curbs on online pharmacies

status_message: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) on Thursday decided not to accept any offer for the repurchase of Rs 6,500 crore of inflation-indexed bonds maturing in 2023, a move that has riled institutional players.
link_name: Mkts saddled with Rs 6,500-cr inflation bonds
Rupee falls to 67.25, lowest since 2013 crisis

status_message: At least five people were killed and 36 injured in a car bomb attack on a police headquarters in Turkey's Cinar district, BBC reported.
link_name: 5 dead, 36 wounded in PKK attack on police headquarters in southeast Turkey

status_message: Paytm, India's largest mobile phone wallet provider, is set to make inroads into the travel space. It is planning to build the country's largest travel marketplace and provide all types of travel and tourism solutions, including cab rides; bus, train and air tickets; hotel bookings; visa facilitation; foreign exchange and international mobile phone cards.
link_name: Paytm to foray into travel marketplace

status_message: Interview with CIDCO's VC & MD, Sanjay Bhatia
link_name: 'Navi Mumbai Airport to handle 10 million passengers in 2 years'

status_message: As Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), India's largest IT services company announces its financial numbers for the December quarter of FY16, among others, industry analysts would also watch out if its revenue gap with Cognizant is narrowing further or widening.
link_name: TCS Q3 results: Will TCS be able to widen revenue gap with key rival Cognizant?

status_message: After opening in green, markets slipped in the negative territory with participants booking profits at every rally as concerns in China continues to haunt. Caution prevails ahead of the December quarterly earnings season starting today with IT giant TCS and IndusInd Bank posting their numbers.
link_name: Markets under pressure ahead of TCS earnings, key macro data

status_message: Congress party general secretary Digvijaya Singh has petitioned the Central Vigilance Commission (CVC), accusing Road Transport minister Nitin Gadkari of "crony capitalism" and "nepotism" in awarding the Rs 10,050-crore contract for the Zoji La Pass Tunnel in Jammu & Kashmir.
link_name: Cong leader Digvijaya Singh moves CVC against Nitin Gadkari

status_message: A Delhi court today allowed the plea of BJP leader Subramanian Swamy seeking summoning of documents from the Ministries of Finance, Urban Development and Corporate Affairs, Income Tax Department and other agencies in the National Herald case.
link_name: National Herald case: Court allows Swamy's plea to summon documents
PM visits Pathankot, voices satisfaction with response

status_message: The Pathankot attack is not a spontaneous response to recent developments; it is a manifestation of the Pakistani national security strategy to pursue its revisionist agenda against India, says C. Christine Fair, author of Fighting to the End: The Pakistan Army's Way of War, and an associate professor in the Peace and Security Studies Program at Georgetown University's Edmund A Walsh School of Foreign Service.
link_name: Pathankot attack aimed at probing Modi govt's red lines: Christine Fair

status_message: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Friday arrested the founder of PACL Ltd over allegations the property company cheated investors of $6.8 billion, in what local media is calling the country's biggest financial scandal.
link_name: Head of PACL arrested over alleged $6.8 bn investment scam

status_message:
A silent revolution has been brewing in some developed nations of the world. It's called cord-cutting - freeing oneself from the shackles of cable television and shifting to a medium online, where, for a fixed fee, one watches what one wants, at one's leisure.
Abhik Sen writes about binging on wireless content with Netflix's India entry
link_name: Binging with Netflix

status_message: The sari can be what you want it to be. A pair of pants suited for workplace, a casual wrap dress for a day out with friends or flaunt-worthy evening wear â€” few garments have gone through a reinvention as massive as the sari.
link_name: The many ways of draping a sari

status_message: The benchmark Sensex and Nifty dropped 4.7 per cent in the first full week of 2016, their worst weekly performance since November 2011. On Friday, however, the Indian market, similar to global counterparts, saw some calm after the China market rebounded two per cent buoyed by buying of shares by government authorities and suspension of circuit filters.
link_name: Indian markets' worst week in four years

status_message: The constitutionality of the commission of inquiry instituted by the elected city government here for probing the Delhi and District Cricket Association (DDCA) is being disputed by the Union government.
link_name: DDCA probe: Centre says illegal, Kejriwal says only court order can stop it

status_message: If a start-up ecosystem is done right, it should need minimal "protection", and it should be difficult to predict its future. Don't protect, don't predict. Just reduce paperwork and let it thrive writes Mihir Sharma
link_name: Mihir S Sharma: Don't protect start-ups

status_message: Why the govt should not protect start-ups, either by outlawing Free Basics or via tax breaks, writes Mihir S Sharma
link_name: Mihir S Sharma: Don't protect start-ups

status_message: The government has cleared the appointment of Gujarat cadre IAS DK Sikri as the new chairman, Competition Commission of India, even as he was number two in the list recommended by the selection panel, it is learnt.
link_name: DK Sikri to head Competition Commission of India
Wall Street shaken by China turmoil, oil slide
Last rites of Mufti Mohammad Sayeed: A picture gallery

status_message: Setting a precedent for the entire country, the Union tribal affairs ministry has revised its views to re-interpret the Forest Rights Act (FRA) and allow Maharashtra forest department to get control back over forest management and a grip on the lucrative trade worth crores in forest produce such as tendu leaves and bamboo. The ministry had previously concluded that only tribals and other forest dwellers had rights to manage their forests under the FRA.
link_name: Tribal affairs ministry relents over Forest Rights Act

status_message: Benchmark indices have slipped around 1.5% weighed down by index heavyweight shares like Tata Motors, ITC, ICICI Bank and Maruti Suzuki.
link_name: Markets extend losses; Sensex slips below 25,000, Nifty heading towards 7,600

status_message: German auto major Volkswagen, which has been told by the green tribunal to stop selling diesel vehicles fitted with "cheat device", on Wednesday said its cars are not fitted with any such equipment.
link_name: No defeat device in cars; follow BS-IV norms in India: Volkswagen

status_message: Narayana Hrudayalaya listed today at Rs 291, a 16% premium against its issue price of Rs 250 per share on the National Stock Exchange (NSE) and BSE.
link_name: Narayana Hrudayalaya lists at 16% premium to issue price

status_message: The Madhya Pradesh government has set itself a target of irrigating four million hectares by 2018. This is after a fourfold rise in the state's irrigation capacity in the past five years, an achievement that bagged Madhya Pradesh a central government award.
link_name: Drought tests Madhya Pradesh irrigation drive
Barclays to announce investment banking job cuts across Asia next week: Sources

status_message: The Supreme Court on Tuesday upheld a December ruling that temporarily banned the sale of large diesel cars in New Delhi to combat toxic smog in India's capital.
link_name: Supreme Court upholds ban on sale of large diesel vehicles in Delhi

status_message: Forty five Indians and Indian-origin people have made it to Forbes' annual list of achievers under the age of 30 who are "changing the rules of the game or creating entirely new playbooks" across varied fields.

status_message: Calais: A migrant jumps over a fence as he attempts to access the Channel Tunnel, in Calais, northern France. Undeterred by an influx of French riot police, a surveillance helicopter, or a ninth death this summer among the tens of thousands who attempt to cross the Channel, the migrants still come in groups of a dozen or more. Men and women, some hiding their faces beneath bandannas, walked single file to sneak over a bent fence along the train tracks leading to the tunnel and ultimately to England. AP/PTI

status_message:
Highlights of Reliance Industries Limited's 41st AGM:

- RIL to complete projects worth Rs 2 lakh crore over 12-18 months

- The full benefits of the investment cycle will be realised from FY16-17 onwards

- RIL paid Rs 6,124 crores in taxes in FY15, the highest by any firm

- The firm achieved record profits of Rs 784 crore at EBITDA level in the retail business and added 930 stores last year

- Reliance Retail will scale up its presence from 200 cities to 900 cities by next year

- Reliance Jio is now present in all 29 states of India. Wireless footprint covers over 1 lakh villages

- Reliance Jio will launch commercial operations in December this year

- Reliance Jio will launch new smartphone applications in the next few months

- Jio Money, a digital payment system, is being developed. A pilot project is being carried out at select Reliance campuses

- RIL has spectrum in the 2,300, 1,800 and 800 Mhz bands in almost all circles. The cumulative investment is Rs 34,000 crore
link_name: Timeline Photos

Hong Kongers held a candlelight vigil Thursday night to mark the suppression of the 1989 student-led Tiananmen Square protests, an annual event that takes on greater meaning for the city's young after last autumn's pro-democracy demonstrations sharpened their sense of unease with Beijing

status_message: Zurich  :FIFA president Sepp Blatter after his election as President at the Hallenstadion in Zurich, Switzerland, Friday, May 29, 2015. Blatter has been re-elected as FIFA president for a fifth term, chosen to lead world soccer despite separate U.S. and Swiss criminal investigations into corruption. The 209 FIFA member federations gave the 79-year-old Blatter another four-year term on Friday after Prince Ali bin al-Hussein of Jordan conceded defeat after losing 133-73 in the first round. AP/PTI
